column4: dual booting causes lots of confusion .  suggest you start over, DO NOT import your windows accounts
can anyone help me with major Ubuntu 10.04 install issues?
acerimmer: I thought that was the problem
dual booting is a natural setup.  unlikely to cause probs beyond operator confusion
acerimmer: so you suggest that I should go back and reinstall and just skip that import account part?
you should have 2 windows partitions.  One restore part and athe normal system part.  Delete all other parts
acerimmer: how do i delete partitions? what software should i use?
acerimmer: are you talking about gparted?
acerimmer & gbillings: ok thanks a lot.
ok, so i just start it up and it is pretty staright forward?
when you get to the partitioning step, just don't touch those windows parts.
acerimmer: ok, so all i do is delete the ubuntu ones?
